intro: Melissa corsica, commonly known as sweet beebrush, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and basil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems and bloom in late spring to early summer. Melissa corsica is valued for its fragrant leaves, which are used in traditional herbal remedies and as a source of essential oils.
